SHORTEN: No it‚Äôs not, but what I would say to you is that if you have $5 million in superannuation and retirement you probably don‚Äôt need the rest of the taxpayers stuck in the traffic this morning paying for you to get a tax concession.
ID: 10773974 4. In parliament on Monday Labor goaded prime minister Malcolm Turnbull, who snapped at Shorten, calling his new position ‚Äúhypocrisy‚Äù. Would you call Australians on $180,000/year "rich"?

‚Äî Anna Spargo-Ryan (@annaspargoryan) ID: 10773997 8. Last time this question came up The Guardian ‚Äôs economics guru Greg Jericho crunched some numbers and found the MEDIAN taxable income for a single person is about $50,000 per year. @MarkDiStef well off, yes. Not rich.
‚Äî shan (@shanbennet) ID: 10774004 9. We can all agree that $180,000 is a lot more than someone on welfare benefits receives. @MarkDiStef @NannanBay If you're on $13,000 Newstart, well then $180,000 is unbelievably rich.
‚Äî Lucy Donoghue (@lucymdonoghue) ID: 10774003 10. And many people suggested the ‚Äúrich‚Äù part of the equation really depends on how much people SPEND. @MarkDiStef Income + Wealth are related, but not synonymous. Someone earning $180Kpa may have saved a million or pissed it away. Ditto $80K.
